content: pixie pointed hood designed by earth tricks materials work this piece with super bulky weight yarn or two strands of worsted weight use a huge a variety of textures and colors to achieve a funky look completed hood takes about 2 5 skeins or 250-300yd of super bulky yarn hook 8 00mm this pattern is worked largely in a round the pattern begins at the point of the hood slowly increases and opens up to cover the head at the neck the hood is worked in increasing row you may want to work your hood longer or shorter the pattern can easily omit row or add row as long as you re still following the general increasing pattern thankfully this chunky hood is extremely forgiving and is easily modified note increase double_crochet means double_crochet twice in same stitch round 1 create a magic_ring and double_crochet 6 times ​ round 2 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet throughout 2 double_crochet increase double_crochet 2 double_crochet increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 8 double_crochet ​ round 3 chain 3 3 double_crochet increase double_crochet 3 double_crochet increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 10 double_crochet ​ ​ ​ round 4 chain 3 double_crochet across slip_stitch to close 10 double_crochet ​ round 5 chain 3 4 double_crochet increase double_crochet 4 double_crochet increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 12 double_crochet ​ round 6 chain 3 5dc increase double_crochet 5 double_crochet increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 14 double_crochet ​ round 7 chain 3 double_crochet across slip_stitch to close 14 double_crochet ​ rnds 8-19 continue this increasing pattern increase for two row then double_crochet around for the third ​ ​ row 16 double_crochet 18dc 18dc 20dc 22dc 22dc 24dc 26dc 26dc 28dc 30dc 30dc round 20 chain 3 double_crochet 15 increase double_crochet double_crochet 15 increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 32 double_crochet ​ round 21 chain 3 double_crochet across slip_stitch to close 32dc ​ round 22 chain 3 double_crochet 16 increase double_crochet double_crochet 16 increase double_crochet slip_stitch to close 34 double_crochet ​ ​ ​ round 23 chain 3 double_crochet across slip_stitch to close 34 double_crochet fasten_off ​ pause here and read hold your tail portion up to the nape of your neck and gauge its length at this point you can either continue on to working the portion of the hood that covers your head or if you d like your tail portion to be longer continue the increasing pattern increase one row double_crochet across second row until it is the length you desire then continue on round 23 is the last row you work in a round starting at now you will be working in row place a marker anywhere on the round then place a second one 10 double_crochet away these two markers are your neck markers the 10 double_crochet space will sit at the nape of your neck fold your piece in half with your two markers touching find the center point between your markers not on the neck space but on what will become the top of your hood
